abstract: Audit by city comptroller John C Liu finds that the Equal Employment Practices Commission, New York City's watchdog on discrimination issues, has fallen so far behind on its workload that it should consider private financing to compensate for chronic budget cuts.
snippet: The Equal Employment Practices Commission has fallen so far behind that it should consider private financing, according to an audit from the city comptroller.
lead_paragraph: The Equal Employment Practices Commission has fallen so far behind that it should consider private financing, according to an audit from the city comptroller.

headline.main: Deep Backlog Is Detailed at City’s Bias Watchdog
headline.print_headline: Deep Backlog Is Detailed At City’s Bias Watchdog
headline.seo: Antidiscrimination Watchdog Falling Behind on Its Work, Liu Charges
